course.subject: ELEC
course.name: Integrated Power Electronics
course.description: Power computation, diodes and rectifier circuits, power factor correctors, switch mode power converters, magnetic components, switch capacitor power converters, linear regulators, and integrated circuit techniques for controller design.

reviews.author: garbage
reviews.title: Nice introduction to very basic power electronics.
reviews.comment_content:
Power Computation
Rectifier
Switch Mode Power Converters (DC-DC)
Control and Feedback (basic)
Magnetism

The content is not much since it does not include regulators and in-depth knowledge about control and transistor level circuits.

Really wish it could include some more advanced topics such as bandgap reference, charge pump, and DC-AC inverters in order to prepare us for the much more complicated design problems in the industry, but the fact is that this is UST and the syllabus only becomes less and less over the years. :(
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is nice. The professor is very clear about the course content and is really willing to help the students even though he is very busy.
reviews.comment_grading:
4% for 3 assignment each.
22% for project 1
26% for project 2
40% for final exam

Most people get full mark on the first 60%.

The final exam is easy as long as you can understand and perform the derivations of the formulae. It emphasized a lot on SMPC.

The mean of final exam is 47/100, and the upper quartile is 64. Would update when the grade comes out.
reviews.comment_workload:
3 very easy homework assignments and 2 very easy projects.

The final may consume more time since it is closed book and the formula sheet provided was not really that helpful.

It does not include laboratory sessions, which might be good news for some but I find it quite sad.
